section.title: Deliberate Practice: Multiplication Concepts
section.p: Algebra is a skill, which means it requires practice to become proficient. But it will take more than rote repetition to get there. Deliberate practice is the thoughtful repetition of a task. For each of these sections, you will be given a list of specific skills or ideas to focus on as you practice thinking through the problems.

li.p: Draw the appropriate diagrams based on the instructions.

worksheet.p: Instructions: Perform the indicated calculation using A groups of B and a movement diagram.

exercise.p: Calculate 3 \cdot (-4) as A groups of B and as movement.
Calculate (-4) \cdot 3 as A groups of B and as movement.
Calculate 2 \cdot (-5) as A groups of B and as movement.
Calculate 3 \cdot 2 as A groups of B and as movement.
Calculate (-2) \cdot (-4) as A groups of B and as movement.
Calculate (-3) \cdot 5 as A groups of B and as movement.

worksheet.p: Instructions: Perform the indicated calculation using a diagram of base-10 blocks.

exercise.p: Calculate 12 \cdot 24 using a diagram of base-10 blocks.
Calculate 24 \cdot 16 using a diagram of base-10 blocks.
Calculate 11 \cdot 32 using a diagram of base-10 blocks.
Calculate 26 \cdot 14 using a diagram of base-10 blocks.
